column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////First time diner here.  I really liked the atmosphere.  The service was cheerful and attentive.  A fairly large selection of different styles of Ramen
column2: plus plenty of other dishes for those inclined for rice bowls
column4: or small plates.  The gyoza (potstickers) were particularly good
column5: and I liked that an order was 8 two-bite dumplings
column6: rather than several large ones (better for those of us with a limited chopstick proficiency).  The spicy miso ramen was so good
column7: probably one of the best I've had in town
column8: and a formidable competitor to what I get on my regular trips to Tokyo.
